concept.title: Block Reference Entities
concept.shortdesc: A Block Reference is an entity that references a block definition within the current drawing.

conbody.p: It can contain any combination of entities including 2D and 3D. You can create Block Reference entities using several methods including the INSERT command. Modify Block Reference entities with relevant grips and properties in addition to general editing tools.

section.title: Block Reference Grips
section.p: A selected Block Reference entity displays a grip at its insertion point. The grip allows you to move the Block Reference. Grip Settings enable you to control the appearance and behavior of grips.

section.title: Block Reference Properties
section.p: A selected Block Reference entity displays Geometry and Misc properties in addition to General and 3D Visualization properties. Extra properties may be displayed for dynamic and parametric blocks.

dlentry.dd: Geometry properties describe the geometric characteristics of the entity.
Describes the absolute coordinates of the insertion point in the UCS, based on the cartesian coordinate system (X,Y,Z).
Describes the scale factor along the X axis.
Describes the scale factor along the Y axis.
Describes the scale factor along the Z axis.
Describes the lowest (minimum) and highest (maximum) elevations of the entity in the current UCS.
Describes the angle of the entity from the XY-plane.
Misc properties describe additional characteristics of the entity.
Describes whether the entity is annotative.
Describes the entity name.
Describes the rotation of the entity in the XY plane.
Describes the insertion units of the block as defined by the in the block definition.
Describes the ratio of the block insertion units to the drawing insertion units as defined by the in the block definition and the current drawing.
Describes whether the block can be exploded.
Custom properties describe the available options for a dynamic block.
BIM properties describe the available options for a BIM block.
Mechanical component properties describe the available options for a mechanical block.
Instance properties describe the name of the block as a variation from the original block name. Typically this is the name of the block followed by an incremental number.
Standard part properties describe the entity if it came from the Bricsys Standard Parts library.
Parameters properties describe the editable characteristics of the entity.
Component’s materials properties describe the materials of the entity.
Mass properties describe the volume and mass of the entity.
